definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Enlightment is an alternative to life.
sentences.chinese: 開悟是生命的另一選擇。

sentences.english: After enlightenment; chop wood, carry water.
Maharaj: What do you mean by realisation and liberation?
sentences.chinese: 你所說的開悟和解脫是什麼意思？

sentences.english: The goals of yoga are varied and range from improving health to achieving Moksha (enlightenment).
sentences.chinese: 瑜珈的目的各不相同，從強身健體到尋求開悟。

sentences.english: Maharaj: I met my Guru when I was 34 and realised by 37.
sentences.chinese: 當遇到我的古魯時我34歲並於37歲開悟。

sentences.english: Before enlightenment; chop wood, carry water.
As far as I know, nobody got enlightened in these retreats.
sentences.chinese: 據我所知，這些課程裏沒有一個人開悟了。

sentences.english: Relative Bodhicitta is the motivation to attain enlightenment for the benefit of others.
sentences.chinese: 相對菩提心乃爲利益衆生而開悟的初發心。

sentences.english: The one that is to be enlightened has to know the One that enlightens it.
sentences.chinese: 一個要成爲開悟的人，必須知道啓蒙它的那個。

sentences.english: The question is how you yourself can become so.
sentences.chinese: 心觀和尚問，“重要的是你自己能不能開悟。

sentences.english: After enlightenment; chop wood, carry water.” ~Zen proverb
If one wants to die consciously, the only way is to be enlightened.
sentences.chinese: 一個人倘使想有意識地死去，唯一的辦法就是開悟。

sentences.english: At that moment the disciple was Enlightened.
He was called Buddha because he was enlightened.
sentences.chinese: 他被稱爲佛是因爲他已得道開悟。

sentences.english: "What kind of a person does Enlightenment produce"?
